page.title: 14BARLOW VILLAGE
page.content: In the{North West}corner of our area is{Crowhole Reservoir}where local people go{fishing by licence}from the {Severn Trent Water Authority.}Part of the area is transversed by the{Sud {Brook}which is the{Parish Boundary between{Cutthorpe and Barlow.}At {Bolehill,}there is a{Plant nursery and{Hardy's}have a{milk round}here. On going down{Wilkin Hill}you come to {Barlow Church,}a{Shop}selling{antique {furniture}and{a well}from by_gone days.The well is dressed with flowers in{August.}Like{Cutthorpe,}this is the only other village to use{whole flower {heads}instead of petals for well dressings.There is a large farm called {Elm Tree Farm}where they have hens in wire cages. There are 5 hens in each cage and they spend all their life penned up to produce eggs more efficiently. There are{10,400 hens.
